Header: South Africa rejoices as world champion Springboks arrive home with Webb Ellis Cup
Content: South Africa captain Siya Kolisi received a hero’s welcome as he carried the Webb Ellis Cup through thousands of fans upon the team’s return home. Kolisi led the Springboks to victory in Japan when they beat England 32-12 in the final in Yokohama, a third title for the country after 1995 and 2007 and the first under a black captain. Kolisi said the victory was for the whole of South Africa, while Coach Rassie Erasmus hoped that their triumph could be used as a springboard for positive change in the country.
